question: Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium name changed to what?
solution:
• The Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium, located in Khandheri, Rajkot, Gujarat, was officially renamed to Niranjan Shah Stadium on 14 February 2024.
  • The renaming honors Niranjan Shah, a former first-class cricketer and long-serving honorary secretary of the Saurashtra Cricket Association (SCA).
  • He played a pivotal role in developing cricket infrastructure in the Saurashtra region and was instrumental in establishing the stadium.
  • The stadium is known for hosting international matches, including Tests, ODIs, and T20Is, and was the home ground for Gujarat Lions during IPL 2016–17.
  • It is also India’s second and Gujarat’s first solar-powered stadium, generating approx. 82,000 units of solar energy annually.
  • The venue has witnessed memorable performances by players like Yuvraj Singh, Ravindra Jadeja, and Suryakumar Yadav.

question: What key elements are featured in the new flag and insignia of the Supreme Court of India unveiled in 2024?
option_1: Ashoka Chakra, Supreme Court building, Constitution book
option_2: Tricolor, Supreme Court logo, Satyamev Jayate
option_3: Lion Capital, Parliament building, Justice scale
option_4: Ashoka Chakra, Parliament dome, National Anthem
solution:
• Unveiled on 1 September 2024 by President Droupadi Murmu during the 75th anniversary of the Supreme Court.
  • Designed by NIFT Delhi, the flag is blue and features:
    • Ashoka Chakra
    • Supreme Court building
    • Book of the Constitution of India
  • The insignia includes the Sanskrit phrase “Yato Dharmastato Jayah” (Where there is Dharma, there is victory) in Devanagari script.
  • Available in multiple formats: table flags, pole flags, wooden frames, etc.
  • Symbolizes justice, democracy, and constitutional values.

question: What is the Sudarshan Setu old name?
solution:
• Sudarshan Setu, inaugurated on 25 February 2024, is India’s longest cable-stayed bridge, connecting Okha mainland to Beyt Dwarka island in Gujarat.
  • Its old name was “Signature Bridge”, used during its planning and construction phase.
  • The bridge spans 32 km and was built at a cost of ₹979 crore.
  • It was renamed Sudarshan Setu, inspired by Lord Krishna’s divine weapon “Sudarshan Chakra”, symbolizing protection and spiritual strength.
  • The bridge features verses from the Bhagavad Gita and images of Lord Krishna along its pedestrian pathways.
  • It includes solar panels generating 1 MW electricity, making it a model of sustainable infrastructure.
  • The bridge drastically improves access to Dwarkadhish Temple, a major pilgrimage site, replacing the earlier boat-only route.
  • It was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who emphasized its role in cultural connectivity and tourism development.

question: Train 18 name changed to what?
solution:
• Train 18, India’s first engine-less semi-high-speed train, was renamed as Vande Bharat Express in January 2019.
  • It was developed by Integral Coach Factory (ICF), Chennai under the ‘Make in India’ initiative.
  • The name “Vande Bharat” was chosen to reflect national pride and indigenous innovation.
  • Railway Minister Piyush Goyal announced the name change, calling it a tribute to the nation.
  • The train was flagged off by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 15 February 2019, running between New Delhi and Varanasi.
  • Sudhanshu Mani, then GM of ICF, is credited as the innovator behind Train 18, and is often referred to as the “Father of Vande Bharat”.
  • It is considered a successor to the Shatabdi Express, offering faster travel and modern amenities.

question: What is the new name of the hockey stadium in Rae Bareli, Uttar Pradesh, renamed in honor of a female Indian hockey player?
option_1: Rani Rampal Hockey Arena
option_2: Rani’s Girls Hockey Turf
option_3: Rani Rampal Sports Complex
solution:
• In March 2023, the MCF Rae Bareli renamed its hockey stadium as “Rani’s Girls Hockey Turf”.
  • This honors Rani Rampal, a celebrated player of the Indian Women’s Hockey Team, and marks her as the first Indian woman hockey player to have a stadium named after her.
  • Rani Rampal has represented India in over 250 international matches, including the FIH Pro League, Asian Games, and Olympics.
  • The renaming aims to inspire young female athletes and promote women’s participation in sports.
  • Rani expressed her gratitude on social media, dedicating the honor to the entire Indian women’s hockey team.

question: What is the official name of Ayodhya Airport inaugurated in December 2023?
option_1: Ram Janmabhoomi International Airport
option_2: Ayodhya Dham International Airport
option_3: Maharishi Valmiki International Airport
option_4: Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport
solution:
• The airport was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on 30 December 2023, and flight operations began on 10 January 2024.
  • It is located in Ayodhya (Faizabad) district, adjacent to NH-27 and NH-330, serving Ayodhya and Faizabad.
  • The name honors Maharishi Valmiki, the author of the Ramayana, aligning with the airport’s Ramayana-themed architecture and murals.
  • Initially proposed to be named after Lord Ram, the final name was chosen to reflect literary and cultural heritage.
  • The airport handled over 1.1 million passengers in its first operational year, making it one of India’s fastest-growing airports.
  • It currently operates domestic flights, with plans for international expansion in future phases.

question: What symbolic changes were introduced in the new Lady Justice statue unveiled at the Supreme Court of India in 2024?
option_1: Blindfold removed and sword retained
option_2: Sword replaced with the Constitution and robe replaced with saree
option_3: Blindfold replaced with crown and sword retained
option_4: Blindfold removed and robe replaced with western gown
solution:
• Unveiled in October 2024, the new Lady Justice statue at the Supreme Court of India reflects a shift from colonial symbolism to indigenous representation.
  • The blindfold was removed, signifying that Indian law is aware and informed, not blind.
  • The sword was replaced with the Constitution, emphasizing justice based on constitutional values rather than punishment.
  • The robe was replaced with a traditional Indian saree, symbolizing cultural identity.
  • The statue retains the scales of justice, representing balance and impartiality.
  • Additional Indian elements include a bindi, crown, and traditional jewelry, reinforcing the theme of Bharatiyata (Indianness).
  • This transformation was initiated under the guidance of Chief Justice D.Y. Chandrachud as part of broader judicial reforms.
  • The statue is installed in the Judges’ Library of the Supreme Court.

question: What are the new names of Ashok Hall and Durbar Hall in Rashtrapati Bhavan as announced in 2024?
option_1: Ashoka Mandap and Samvidhan Mandap
option_2: Ashok Mandap and Ganatantra Mandap
option_3: Ashok Bhawan and Ganatantra Bhawan
option_4: Samvidhan Bhawan and Ganatantra Bhawan
solution:
• On July 25, 2024, President Droupadi Murmu announced the renaming of two ceremonial halls in Rashtrapati Bhavan.
  • Durbar Hall was renamed as Ganatantra Mandap, reflecting India’s republican values and moving away from colonial terminology.
  • Ashok Hall, originally a ballroom, was renamed as Ashok Mandap to uphold Indian cultural ethos and remove anglicized traces.
  • The term ‘Ashok’ connects to Emperor Ashoka, the Ashok tree, and the National Emblem (Lion Capital of Ashoka).
  • These changes are part of a broader initiative to decolonize official nomenclature and promote Bharatiyata (Indianness).
  • Durbar Hall hosts major events like National Awards and swearing-in ceremonies, while Ashok Hall is used for diplomatic introductions and credential presentations.

question: Fort William, recently renamed as Vijay Durg, is located in which city of India?
solution:
• Fort William is located in Kolkata, West Bengal.
  • Originally built by the British East India Company between 1696–1706, it was reconstructed after the Battle of Plassey from 1758–1781.
  • It was named after King William III of England and served as a major military base during British rule.
  • In 2025, it was renamed as “Vijay Durg” to honor India’s indigenous heritage and eliminate colonial imprints.
  • The name pays tribute to the historic Maratha naval fort on Maharashtra’s Sindhudurg coast, associated with Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.
  • Currently, it serves as the headquarters of the Indian Army’s Eastern Command and is not open to the general public.

question: Ross Island of Andaman & Nicobar was renamed to what?
option_2: Netaji Subhash Chandrabose Island
option_3: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Island
solution:
• Ross Island was officially renamed as Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Island in 2018.
  • This honors Netaji, who visited the Andaman Islands in 1943 and declared them part of free India.
  • Netaji’s famous slogan: “Give me blood, and I will give you freedom” energized the freedom movement.
  • He chaired the Haripura Congress Session in 1938, became Congress President, and later founded Forward Bloc (1939).
  • He established the Azad Hind Fauj (Indian National Army) in 1943, promoting Indian independence with Japanese support.
  • The renaming was announced by PM Narendra Modi to honor national heroes.

question: Al Minhad City in UAE was renamed to what?
solution:
• Al Minhad City in the UAE was officially renamed as Hind City in 2023.
  • The renaming reflects the strong and historic ties between India and the UAE, emphasizing cultural and diplomatic relations.
  • The name Hind is derived from the Arabic term for India, symbolizing the deep-rooted connection between the two nations.
  • This change was part of a broader initiative to strengthen bilateral relations and mutual respect between the countries.

question: What is the old name of Mukhyamantri Ayushman Aarogya Yojana?
option_1: Rajasthan Health Assurance Scheme
option_2: Ayushman Bharat Chiranjivi Yojana
option_3: Mukhyamantri Chiranjivi Swasthya Yojana
solution:
The Chiranjivi Yojana has been renamed as Mukhyamantri Ayushman Aarogya Yojana.
  • This renaming aligns the scheme with the Ayushman Bharat initiative, emphasizing universal health coverage.
  • The scheme provides cashless treatment up to ₹5 lakh per family annually in empanelled hospitals.
  • It was originally launched in 2021 to ensure healthcare access for all residents of Rajasthan.

question: Kaksar Bridge (Ladakh) name changed to what?
option_1: Captain Vikram Batra Setu
option_2: Captain Amit Bhardwaj Setu
option_3: Captain Manoj Pandey Setu
option_4: Captain Saurabh Kalia Setu
solution:
• The Kaksar Bridge in Ladakh has been renamed as Captain Amit Bhardwaj Setu.
  • This renaming honors Captain Amit Bhardwaj, a brave soldier who made the ultimate sacrifice for the nation.
  • The bridge is strategically important, connecting remote areas in Ladakh and facilitating movement for civilians and the armed forces.
  • Such dedications serve as a tribute to the valor and dedication of Indian soldiers.

question: Sarai Kale Kha Chowk (Delhi) name changed to what?
option_3: Subhash Chandra Bose Chowk
solution:
• The Sarai Kale Kha Chowk in Delhi has been renamed as Birsa Munda Chowk.
  • This renaming honors Birsa Munda, a tribal freedom fighter and leader who played a significant role in India’s independence movement.
  • Birsa Munda is remembered for his contributions to tribal rights and his resistance against British colonial rule.
  • The renaming reflects the government’s effort to recognize and celebrate the legacy of tribal leaders in India.

question: Karimganj district (Assam) name changed to what?
solution:
• The Karimganj district in Assam has been renamed as Shreebhumi.
  • The name change reflects cultural and historical significance, aiming to highlight the region’s heritage and identity.
  • Karimganj is located in the Barak Valley region of Assam and is known for its rich biodiversity and cultural diversity.
  • Such renaming initiatives often aim to preserve and promote local traditions and pride.

question: Dhyan Chand Lifetime Achievement Award has been renamed to what?
option_1: Major Dhyan Chand Award
option_3: Khel Ratna Lifetime Award
option_4: Bharat Ratna Sports Award
solution:
• The Dhyan Chand Lifetime Achievement Award has been renamed as the Arjuna Lifetime Award.
  • This renaming aligns the award with the prestigious Arjuna Awards, which recognize outstanding achievements in sports.
  • The award continues to honor individuals for their lifetime contributions to sports and games in India.
  • It is named after Arjuna, a legendary figure in Indian mythology, symbolizing excellence and dedication.

question: Jhelum Stadium (J&K) has been renamed to what?
option_1: General Bipin Rawat Stadium
option_2: General Sam Manekshaw Stadium
option_3: General Arjan Singh Stadium
solution:
• The Jhelum Stadium in Jammu & Kashmir has been renamed as General Bipin Rawat Stadium.
  • This renaming honors General Bipin Rawat, India’s first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS).
  • General Rawat played a pivotal role in modernizing India’s armed forces and enhancing jointness among the three services (Army, Navy, and Air Force).
  • He tragically passed away in a helicopter crash on December 8, 2021, but his legacy continues to inspire the nation.

question: Udhampur Railway Station (J&K) has been renamed to what?
option_1: Shaheed Captain Vikram Batra Railway Station
option_2: Shaheed Captain Tushar Mahajan Railway Station
option_3: Shaheed Captain Manoj Pandey Railway Station
option_4: Shaheed Captain Saurabh Kalia Railway Station
solution:
• The Udhampur Railway Station in Jammu & Kashmir has been renamed as Shaheed Captain Tushar Mahajan Railway Station.
  • This renaming honors Captain Tushar Mahajan, a brave officer of the Indian Army who sacrificed his life during an anti-terror operation in Pampore, J&K, in 2016.
  • The renaming is a tribute to his valor and dedication to the nation.

question: What was the old name of Asmita Mahila League?
option_3: Khelo India Mahila League
solution:
The Khelo India Mahila League has been renamed as Asmita Mahila League.
  • The renaming aims to emphasize the empowerment and identity of women in sports.
  • "Asmita" symbolizes pride and self-respect, reflecting the league’s focus on promoting women’s participation in sports.

question: Old Parliament House name changed to what?
solution:
• The Old Parliament House has been renamed as Samvidhan Sadan.
  • This renaming reflects the importance of the Constitution (Samvidhan) in Indian democracy.
  • The name emphasizes the building’s historical and constitutional significance as the place where India’s Constitution was drafted and adopted.

question: Shaheed Dweep is the new name of which island?
solution:
• Neil Island was renamed Shaheed Dweep in December 2018 as a tribute to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose.
  • The renaming was announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his visit to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
  • The name Shaheed (Martyr) honors the sacrifices made by Indian freedom fighters, especially Netaji, who declared the islands part of Azad Hind in 1943.
  • Andaman and Nicobar Islands hold great historical significance in India’s independence struggle.

question: Swaraj Dweep is the new name of which island?
solution:
• Havelock Island was renamed Swaraj Dweep in December 2018 as a tribute to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose.
  • The renaming was announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his visit to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
  • The name Swaraj (Self-rule) reflects Netaji’s vision of independence and self-governance.
  • Havelock Island is a popular tourist destination known for its beautiful beaches and coral reefs.

question: Narmadapuram is the new name of which city?
solution:
• Hoshangabad was renamed Narmadapuram in February 2022 to honor the Narmada River, which holds cultural and spiritual significance in India.
  • The renaming was officially approved by the Government of Madhya Pradesh.
  • Hoshangabad is located on the banks of the Narmada River and is known for its scenic beauty and historical importance.
  • The name change reflects the region’s deep connection to the river and its heritage.

question: Prayagraj is the new name of which city?
solution:
• Allahabad was renamed Prayagraj in October 2018 by the Government of Uttar Pradesh.
  • The name Prayagraj refers to the confluence (Sangam) of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati rivers, which is a sacred site in Hinduism.
  • The city is historically and culturally significant, hosting the Kumbh Mela, one of the largest religious gatherings in the world.
  • The renaming aimed to restore the city’s ancient identity and cultural heritage.

question: Ayodhya is the new name of which city?
solution:
• Faizabad was renamed Ayodhya in November 2018 by the Government of Uttar Pradesh.
  • Ayodhya is considered the birthplace of Lord Rama and holds immense religious significance in Hinduism.
  • The renaming was part of efforts to highlight the city’s cultural and historical importance.
  • Ayodhya is a major pilgrimage site and central to the Ramayana epic.

question: Amrit Udyan is the new name of which garden?
solution:
• Mughal Garden was renamed Amrit Udyan in January 2023 by the Government of India.
  • The renaming was part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav celebrations, marking 75 years of India’s independence.
  • Amrit Udyan is located in the Rashtrapati Bhavan and is famous for its beautiful landscaping and variety of flowers.
  • The name change reflects India’s cultural heritage and independence.

question: Sri Vijaya Puram is the new name of which city?
solution:
• Port Blair, the capital of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, was proposed to be renamed Sri Vijaya Puram to honor the historical significance of the Sri Vijaya Empire.
  • The Sri Vijaya Empire was a powerful maritime empire that ruled parts of Southeast Asia and had cultural and trade connections with India.
  • The renaming reflects the historical and cultural ties of the region to ancient Indian maritime history.
  • Port Blair is also known for its role in India’s freedom struggle, particularly the Cellular Jail, which housed many freedom fighters.

question: Narendra Modi Stadium is the new name of which stadium?
option_4: M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru
solution:
• Motera Stadium, located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, was renamed Narendra Modi Stadium in February 2021.
  • It is the largest cricket stadium in the world, with a seating capacity of over 1,30,000 spectators.
  • The renaming was part of the redevelopment of the stadium, which is part of the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Sports Complex.
  • The stadium has hosted numerous international cricket matches and is a landmark for Indian cricket.

question: Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Airport is the new name of which airport?
solution:
• Aurangabad Airport, located in Maharashtra, was renamed Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Airport in March 2023.
  • The renaming honors Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, the son of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, who was a valiant warrior and the second ruler of the Maratha Empire.
  • The name change reflects the region’s rich history and cultural heritage.
  • The airport serves as a gateway to the Ajanta and Ellora Caves, which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

question: Atal Tunnel is the new name of which tunnel?
option_1: Banihal Tunnel, Jammu & Kashmir
option_2: Jawahar Tunnel, Jammu & Kashmir
option_3: Rohtang Tunnel, Himachal Pradesh
option_4: Chenani-Nashri Tunnel, Jammu & Kashmir
solution:
• Rohtang Tunnel, located in Himachal Pradesh, was renamed Atal Tunnel in December 2019 to honor former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee.
  • The tunnel is one of the longest highway tunnels in the world, spanning 9.02 km, and connects Manali to Lahaul-Spiti Valley.
  • It provides year-round connectivity to the region, which was previously cut off during winters due to heavy snowfall.
  • The renaming recognizes Vajpayee’s vision and contribution to infrastructure development in India.

question: Deendayal Port is the new name of which port?
solution:
• Kandla Port, located in Gujarat, was renamed Deendayal Port in September 2017 to honor Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay, a prominent political thinker and leader.
  • The port is one of the largest and busiest ports in India, handling significant cargo traffic.
  • The renaming reflects the government’s initiative to recognize and celebrate the contributions of Indian leaders.
  • Deendayal Port plays a crucial role in India’s maritime trade and economic growth.

question: Question: Jai Hind Bridge is the new name of which bridge?
solution:
Solution:
  • Majerhat Bridge, located in Kolkata, West Bengal, was renamed Jai Hind Bridge in December 2020.
  • This renaming honors the legacy of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose and his iconic slogan “Jai Hind”.
  • The bridge is a vital transportation link in the city, improving connectivity and easing traffic congestion.
  • It stands as a symbol of national pride and remembrance.

question: Question: Kartavya Path is the new name of which road?
solution:
Solution:
  • Rajpath, located in New Delhi, was renamed Kartavya Path in September 2022.
  • The renaming reflects the government’s vision to emphasize duty and responsibility, moving away from colonial connotations associated with the name Rajpath, which means "King's Way".
  • Kartavya Path, meaning "Path of Duty", symbolizes the spirit of democracy and the importance of public service.
  • It is a central avenue in the capital, stretching from Rashtrapati Bhavan to India Gate, and is a key venue for national events like the Republic Day Parade.

question: Question: Ahilyadevi Nagar is the new name of which city in Maharashtra?
solution:
Solution:
  • Ahmednagar, located in Maharashtra, was renamed Ahilyadevi Nagar in 2023.
  • The renaming honors Ahilyabai Holkar, a revered queen known for her administrative brilliance and temple restorations.
  • She symbolizes women’s empowerment and effective leadership in Indian history.

question: Question: Devgiri Fort is the renamed identity of which fort?
solution:
Solution:
  • Daulatabad Fort, situated near Aurangabad in Maharashtra, was renamed Devgiri Fort, reflecting its historical roots.
  • Devgiri was the original name before it was renamed by Sultan Muhammad bin Tughlaq.
  • The fort is known for its architectural ingenuity and strategic design.

question: Question: Shaheed Bhagat Singh International Airport is the new name of which airport?
solution:
Solution:
  • Chandigarh International Airport was renamed Shaheed Bhagat Singh International Airport in September 2022.
  • This renaming commemorates the martyrdom of Bhagat Singh, one of India’s most iconic freedom fighters.
  • The name aims to instill patriotic pride and acknowledge his immense contribution.

question: Question: Sambhaji Nagar is the new name of which city?
solution:
Solution:
  • Aurangabad, located in Maharashtra, was renamed Sambhaji Nagar in 2023.
  • The name pays tribute to Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, son of Shivaji Maharaj and a valiant warrior.
  • It marks an effort to replace Mughal-era names with local historical figures.

question: Question: Dharashiv is the new name of which city in Maharashtra?
solution:
Solution:
  • Osmanabad, a city in Maharashtra, was renamed Dharashiv in 2023.
  • The name is inspired by the Dharashiv caves, which are ancient Buddhist caves located nearby.
  • This renaming emphasizes cultural heritage and historical continuity.

question: Chandrayaan-3's lunar landing site was renamed to what?
solution:
• Chandrayaan-3 successfully landed near the Moon’s south pole on August 23, 2023.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the name “Shiv Shakti Point” on August 26, 2023.
  • The name reflects “Shiv” as the spirit of resolution and “Shakti” as the strength to fulfill it.
  • It honors the contribution of women scientists in India’s space program.
  • The International Astronomical Union (IAU) officially approved the name “Statio Shiv Shakti” on March 19, 2024.
  • This site lies between lunar craters Manzinus C and Simpelius N at coordinates 69.373°S, 32.319°E.
  • India became the first country to land near the Moon’s south pole.

question: What is the new name of Mopa International Airport?
solution:
• The Greenfield International Airport at Mopa, Goa was officially renamed as Manohar International Airport in December 2022.
  • The name honors Late Manohar Parrikar, former Defence Minister of India and four-time Chief Minister of Goa.
  • The decision was taken by the Goa State Cabinet and approved by the Union Cabinet, fulfilling the aspirations of Goan citizens.
  • The airport was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 11 December 2022, and commercial operations began on 5 January 2023.
  • It is Goa’s second international airport, located in North Goa’s Pernem taluka, and developed by GMR Goa International Airport Limited (GGIAL).
  • Manohar Parrikar was the first IITian to become a Chief Minister, and was posthumously awarded the Padma Bhushan in 2020.
  • The airport is built with sustainable infrastructure, including solar power, green buildings, and rainwater harvesting systems.
